title: Manager, Security Developer Tools
summary: Apple’s static program analysis tools help millions of developers inside and outside of Apple find, fix, and prevent security and stability bugs. Looking for a manager to lead a team responsible for building tools and compiler features to eliminate security vulnerabilities.
description: In this role your primary responsibility will be to manage and support a small team of deeply technical compiler and static analysis engineers who ship tools to find and fix software bugs. The team collaborates closely with operating systems engineers, security engineers, and language designers to improve the security and stability of codebases. Your tasks will include leading the team, developing tools to improve security, and integrating tools with Apple’s IDE and CI teams.
key_qualifications: 5+ years experience leading a technical team and collaborating across organizational boundaries. Experience in compiler development or development of program analysis tools. A strong interest in bug-finding tools and static analysis for C, C++, Objective-C, and Swift. Experience in hiring and developing engineering talent. Strong communication and organizational skills. Excellent software engineering, testing, and debugging ability.
education_experience: B.S. in Computer Science or equivalent experience.
pay_benefits: At Apple, base pay for this role ranges from $190,700 to $329,600 depending on skills, qualifications, experience, and location. Employees can participate in stock programs, receive comprehensive medical and dental coverage, retirement benefits, discounts, free services, educational expense reimbursement, discretionary bonuses or commission payments, and relocation assistance. More benefits information can be found on the Apple Careers page.
